DOMComponentItem.name: Play Animation Clip by Keith
DOMComponentItem.symbolDescription: The Play Animation Component is designed to get rid of the monotonous application of the Play Animation and Play Again buttons in the productions and design of financial training modules at Present Value Asia, Inc. The component is actually very simple. Allows the users to control up to two movie clips and start frames. Also in the summary the user has the option to control the disabling frame which is a frame label.
DOMComponentItem.parametersAsXML: <property id="tClip"> <Inspectable name="Target Clip" variable="tClip" category="" verbose="0" defaultValue="" type="String"/> </property> <property id="tFrame"> <Inspectable name="Target Frame" variable="tFrame" category="" verbose="0" defaultValue="2" type="Number"/> </property> <property id="disabled"> <Inspectable name="Disabling Frame" variable="disabled" category="" verbose="0" defaultValue="" type="String"/> </property> <property id="summary"> <Inspectable name="Summary Part" variable="summary" category="" verbose="0" defaultValue="false" type="Boolean"/> </property> <property id="Summary Disabling "> <Inspectable name="Summary Disabling " variable="Summary Disabling " category="" verbose="0" defaultValue="" type="Default"/> </property> <property id="tClip2"> <Inspectable name="Target Clip 2" variable="tClip2" category="" verbose="0" defaultValue="" type="String"/> </property> <property id="tFrame2"> <Inspectable name="Target Frame 2" variable="tFrame2" category="" verbose="0" defaultValue="0" type="Number"/> </property>
